result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary M Leindecker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  No growing drugs.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No association w/ drug users or dealers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary M Leindecker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Caviale.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Judge Barbara A. Kluka, Acting Br. 6 today only.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Caviale.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Caviale states he would like time to discuss the case w/ADA and review evidence, believes case will be able to resolve.  PLEAH set for 5/12/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Caviale.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Caviale requests time to review the evidence.  FPT continued to 4/19/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Defendant, Gary M Leindecker, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Attorney Jennifer A. Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued. DA  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:45 am.

127 p.m.  Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney John Caviale.  Clk  Janell Thwing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Bond - Continued
